title: Boy ‘kidnapped woman and tried to rape her as she walked through woods’
text:
Manchester Magistrates Court, where the boy will face a youth court over the attempted rape charge (Picture: PA Archive)

A boy has been charged with attempted rape and kidnapping offences in relation to an attack on a 43-year-old woman.

Police were called to reports of an attempted rape in an area of woodland in Wythenshawe, south Manchester.

The boy, 16, who cannot be named for legal reasons, is due to appear at Manchester Youth Court today charged with attempted rape, kidnap and kidnap with intent to commit a sexual offence.

The incident took place on Wednesday 9 October.

Detective Inspector John Robb, of GMP’s City of Manchester division said on Monday: ‘We have provided the woman support from specially trained officers and want to reassure the public that we believe this is an isolated incident and are treating this as a priority.’
